p: In addition to the circulation, we also assessed the impact of DT administration on cell populations in the muscle tissue of control and RRV-T48-infected mice ( Fig 1D and S3 Fig). At 48 h after the last DT administration, we quantified leukocytes in enzymatically-digested muscle tissue by flow cytometry. Muscle tissue from mock-infected mice had low numbers of NK cells and Ly6C hiCD11b + cells that were depleted in DT-treated CCR2-DTR mice. We also detected a population of Ly6C +CD11b +CD11c +CD64 +Ly6G - cells that was unaffected in DT-treated CCR2-DTR mice ( Fig 1D and S3 Fig). NK cells and Ly6C hi cell populations were increased in muscle tissue of RRV-T48-infected mice, and these cells were depleted in RRV-T48-infected CCR2-DTR mice ( Fig 1D and S3 Fig). The Ly6C +CD11b +CD11c +CD64 +Ly6G - cell population found in muscle tissue of mock-infected mice also was unaffected following DT treatment of RRV-T48-infected CCR2-DTR mice ( Fig 1D and S3 Fig). These data indicate that DT treatment of CCR2-DTR mice reduces accumulation of NK cells and Ly6C hi monocytes in muscle tissue.
